summary: This is an FBI lead sheet dated December 6, 2006, summarizing the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution. It details the initiation of the FBI's investigation following a referral from the Palm Beach Police Department, the execution of a search warrant at Epstein's Palm Beach home, the recovery of incriminating evidence, and the identification of victims and witnesses across multiple states. The document notes political influences and sets a target indictment date for January 2007.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the FBI investigation for child prostitution. Described as a part-time resident of Palm Beach who engaged in sexual activity with underage girls.

events.title: FBI Investigation Initiated
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation, Palm Beach County Resident Agency (PBCRA), began investigating Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution.

events.title: Search Warrant Executed at Epstein's Home
events.description: The Palm Beach Police Department obtained and executed a search warrant at Epstein's Palm Beach home. Many belongings, including computer CPUs, were removed prior to the search and never recovered. Incriminating telephone message pads were found.

events.title: Target Indictment Date
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorneys and Case Agents set a target date of January 2007 for indictment, citing media coverage, unknown status of the state investigation, vulnerability of victims, and political influences.

keyFacts: The FBI investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution began on July 24, 2006, following a referral from the Palm Beach Police Department.

A search warrant at Epstein's Palm Beach home found telephone message pads with texts like 'I have a female for him' and 'has girl for tonight,' which were linked to girls who admitted to sexual activity with Epstein.
Critical evidence, including computer CPUs, was removed from Epstein's home prior to the search warrant's execution and was never recovered.
The document cites 'political influences' as a factor considered by prosecutors, alongside media coverage and victim vulnerability, in setting a target indictment date for January 2007.
Epstein maintained residences in Palm Beach, the U.S. Virgin Islands, New York, and New Mexico, and the investigation was developing victims and witnesses from across the United States.
